alert.note: Alert for Perry (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 09 at 8:29AM CST until February 12 at 12:40PM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas... Petit Jean River At Danville affecting Yell County. Fourche Lafave River Near Houston affecting Perry County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Arkansas... Fourche Lafave River Near Gravelly affecting Yell County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Fourche Lafave River Near Houston. * WHEN...Until early Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, State Highway 216 affected. Extensive acreage near Harris Brake Lake and the Wildlife Management Area are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CST Thursday the stage was 27.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 29.1 feet Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 6 AM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Crest Time Date Fourche Lafave R Houston 25.0 27.4 Thu 7 AM 29.1 25.2 20.5 29.1 6 AM 2/10 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
